# myrror

A R package to compare data frames in R. The assumption is that the user
wants the two data frames to be the same.
[`myrror()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/myrror.md)
highlights the differences between values. When there is no difference,
the comparison is “successful”.

## Installation

You can install the released version of myrror from
[CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org) with:

``` r
install.packages("myrror")
```

You can install the development version from
[GitHub](https://github.com/PIP-Technical-Team/myrror) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("PIP-Technical-Team/myrror")
```

## Usage

The main function is
[`myrror()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/myrror.md),
which goes through each single step of the comparison:

``` r
library(myrror)
myrror(survey_data, survey_data_all, by = c('country' = "COUNTRY", "year" = "YEAR"),
       interactive = FALSE)
#> 
#> ── General Information: ──
#> 
#> dfx: survey_data with 16 rows and 6 columns.
#> dfy: survey_data_all with 12 rows and 5 columns.
#> keys dfx: country and year.
#> keys dfy: COUNTRY and YEAR.
#> 
#> ── Note: comparison is done for shared columns and rows. ──
#> 
#> ✔ Total shared columns (no keys): 3
#> ! Non-shared columns in survey_data: 1 ("variable3")
#> ! Non-shared columns in survey_data_all: 0 ()
#> 
#> ✔ Total shared rows: 12
#> ! Non-shared rows in survey_data: 4.
#> ! Non-shared rows in survey_data_all: 0.
#> 
#> ℹ Note: run `extract_diff_rows()` to extract the missing/new rows.
#> 
#> ── 1. Shared Columns Class Comparison ──────────────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> ! 1 shared column(s) have different class(es):
#> 
#>     variable class_x   class_y
#>       <char>  <char>    <char>
#> 1: variable1 numeric character
#> 
#> ── 2. Shared Columns Values Comparison ─────────────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> ! 1 shared column(s) have different value(s):
#> ℹ Note: character-numeric comparison is allowed.
#> 
#> ── Overview: ──
#> 
#> # A tibble: 1 × 4
#>   variable  change_in_value na_to_value value_to_na
#>   <fct>               <int>       <int>       <int>
#> 1 variable2              12           0           0
#> 
#> ── Value comparison: ──
#> 
#> ! 1 shared column(s) have different value(s):
#> ℹ Note: Only first 5 rows shown for each variable.
#> 
#> ── "variable2"
#>               diff indexes country  year variable2.x variable2.y
#>             <char>  <char>  <char> <int>       <num>       <num>
#> 1: change_in_value       5       A  2014  -1.0678237   0.9222675
#> 2: change_in_value       6       A  2015  -0.2179749   2.0500847
#> 3: change_in_value       7       A  2016  -1.0260044  -0.4910312
#> 4: change_in_value       8       A  2017  -0.7288912  -2.3091689
#> 5: change_in_value       9       B  2010  -0.6250393   1.0057385
#> ...
#> 
#> ℹ Note: run `extract_diff_values()` or `extract_diff_table()` to access the results in list or table format.
#> 
#> ✔ End of Myrror Report.
```

## Auxiliary functions

The auxiliary functions go through a specific step of the comparison,
and can be used independently:

- [`compare_type()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/compare_type.md):
  compares the type of shared columns.

- [`compare_values()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/compare_values.md):
  compares the values of shared columns.

- [`extract_diff_values()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/extract_diff_values.md):
  extract the values that are different between two data frames, returns
  a list of data frames with the differences, one for each variable.

- [`extract_diff_table()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/extract_diff_table.md):
  extract the values that are different between two data frames, returns
  a data.table with all differences.

See more in the [Get
started](https://PIP-Technical-team.github.io/myrror/articles/myrror.html)
vignette.

# Package index

## Main Functions

- [`myrror()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/myrror.md)
  : myrror: Compare Data Frames
- [`print(`*`<myrror>`*`)`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/print.myrror.md)
  : Print method for Myrror object.

## Auxiliary Functions

- [`compare_type()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/compare_type.md)
  : Function to compare type of variables of matched data frames.
- [`compare_values()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/compare_values.md)
  : Function to compare values of matched data frames.
- [`extract_diff_values()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/extract_diff_values.md)
  : Extract Different Values Function to extract rows with different
  values between two data frames.
- [`extract_diff_table()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/extract_diff_table.md)
  : Extract Different Values in Table Format Function to extract rows
  with different values between two data frames.
- [`extract_diff_rows()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/extract_diff_rows.md)
  : Extract Different Rows Function to extract missing or new rows from
  comparing two data frames.
- [`clear_last_myrror_object()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/clear_last_myrror_object.md)
  : Clear last myrror object. Internal Function.
- [`create_myrror_object()`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/create_myrror_object.md)
  : Creates a myrror object for comparing two data frames

## Package Datasets: simulated survey data.

- [`survey_data`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/survey_data.md)
  : Survey Data A country-year level dataset with 15 rows and 6
  variables. 2 countries, 4 years, and 4 additional variables.
- [`survey_data_2`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/survey_data_2.md)
  : Survey Data Variation 2
- [`survey_data_2_cap`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/survey_data_2_cap.md)
  : Survey Data Variation 2 with Cap Keys
- [`survey_data_3`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/survey_data_3.md)
  : Survey Data Variation 3
- [`survey_data_4`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/survey_data_4.md)
  : Survey Data Variation 4
- [`survey_data_5`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/survey_data_5.md)
  : Survey Data Variation 5
- [`survey_data_6`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/survey_data_6.md)
  : Survey Data Variation 6
- [`survey_data_all`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/survey_data_all.md)
  : Survey Data Variation All
- [`survey_data_1m`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/survey_data_1m.md)
  : Survey Data 1:m Variation 1
- [`survey_data_1m_2`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/survey_data_1m_2.md)
  : Survey Data 1:m Variation 2
- [`survey_data_m1`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/survey_data_m1.md)
  : Survey Data m:1

## Package Datasets: iris data variations.

- [`iris_var1`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/iris_var1.md)
  : Iris Dataset Variation 1
- [`iris_var2`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/iris_var2.md)
  : Iris Dataset Variation 2
- [`iris_var3`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/iris_var3.md)
  : Iris Dataset Variation 3
- [`iris_var4`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/iris_var4.md)
  : Iris Dataset Variation 4
- [`iris_var5`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/iris_var5.md)
  : Iris Dataset Variation 5
- [`iris_var6`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/iris_var6.md)
  : Iris Dataset Variation 6
- [`iris_var7`](https://PIP-Technical-Team.github.io/myrror/reference/iris_var7.md)
  : Iris Dataset Variation 7
